snippet: After months of struggle and heated debate, the California Bar Association is about to become the first in the country to adopt a formal ethics rule aimed at regulating sexual relationships between lawyers and their clients.    But even as the gro...
lead_paragraph: After months of struggle and heated debate, the California Bar Association is about to become the first in the country to adopt a formal ethics rule aimed at regulating sexual relationships between lawyers and their clients. But even as the group hammers out a compromise rule, some state legislators warn that they may press for a law forbidding lawyers in specialties like divorce to engage in such conduct.

headline.main: Keeping Sex Out of the Law Office

byline.original: By KATHERINE BISHOP, Special to The New York Times
